definition: to ally/to unite/to join/(poetry) antithetical couplet

sentences.english: He said that action was good proof of the reactivity of the coalition.

sentences.english: TACSIM is the prime intelligence simulation for the Army as well as the joint services.

sentences.english: Now it's possible, further down the line, that the coalition might go to the U.N. Security Council to seek additional authority.

sentences.english: The imperial shopping street was burnt down by Anglo-French allied forces in 1860.
sentences.chinese: 帝国的购物街被烧毁了由英法联军于1860年。
